metadata.title: The Pump Matters: An Educational Bundle to Promote a Predominant Mother's-Own-Milk Diet in Very Low Birthweight Infants.

documents.content: The genus Rumex, a member of the Polygonaceae family, includes approximately 200 edible or medicinal species around the world (Vasas et al. 2015). In China, the Rumex species R. longifolius is widely distributed in all regions, except for southern China. In May 2023, typical

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: in all regions, except for southern China. In May 2023, typical powdery mildew symptoms were found on R. longifolius on Longwen Hill (26°23'04'' N, 106°37'57'' E) of Guizhou Normal University, China. The incidence was ~90% among 100 R. longifolius plants observed. The mycelia

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: was ~90% among 100 R. longifolius plants observed. The mycelia initially showed a sporadic distribution on the leaf surface of R. longifolius. In the late stage of infection, the mycelia coalesced into extensive patches and covered nearly the entire leaf surface. White colonies

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: patches and covered nearly the entire leaf surface. White colonies occurred mainly on the leaf adaxial side, occasionally on the leaf abaxial side and petiole. Hyphae were flexuous to straight, branched, 3.5-6.5 μm wide. Hyphal appressoria were lobed to multilobed, in opposite pairs or solitary.

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: appressoria were lobed to multilobed, in opposite pairs or solitary. Conidiophores were erect, straight to slightly flexuous, 60-180 µm long (n = 30). Foot cells were subcylindrical, followed by 2-3 cells. Conidia were ellipsoid to ovoid, 32-50 μm long × 14-25 µm wide (n = 50). Conidia formed

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: ellipsoid to ovoid, 32-50 μm long × 14-25 µm wide (n = 50). Conidia formed singly, occasionally two in a chain. Based on these morphological characteristics, the powdery mildew fungus (named as GZRL-1) was provisionally identified as Erysiphe species (Braun and Cook 2012). To confirm the

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: as Erysiphe species (Braun and Cook 2012). To confirm the species, the ITS and LSU regions were amplified using primer pairs ITS1/ITS4 (White et al. 1990) and NL1/NL4 (Ziemiecki et al. 1990), respectively. The obtained 647-bp ITS sequence (GenBank accession no. PQ856357) shared 100% identity

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: 647-bp ITS sequence (GenBank accession no. PQ856357) shared 100% identity and 99.38% query coverage with previously reported ITS sequences (AF011308, LC328322, and LC328323) of E. polygoni (Saenz and Taylor 1999; Abasova et al. 2018). The obtained 618-bp LSU sequence (PQ857798) shared 100%

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: et al. 2018). The obtained 618-bp LSU sequence (PQ857798) shared 100% identity and 100% query coverage with LSU sequences (LC328322 and LC328323) of E. polygoni (Abasova et al. 2018). Based on the combined ITS and LSU sequences of Erysiphe taxa (Takamatsu et al. 2015), phylogenetic tree was

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: of Erysiphe taxa (Takamatsu et al. 2015), phylogenetic tree was constructed using MEGA 12. The isolate GZRL-1 was grouped in the same clade as E. polygoni. To perform pathogenicity tests, leaves of three healthy potted R. longifolius plants were inoculated by gently pressing

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: potted R. longifolius plants were inoculated by gently pressing with diseased leaves. Three non-inoculated plants were used as controls. All plants were incubated in a greenhouse 25 ± 2°C, 80% relative humidity. After 15 days, the inoculated plants developed typical powdery mildew symptoms,

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: 15 days, the inoculated plants developed typical powdery mildew symptoms, whereas control plants remained symptomless. The fungus from inoculated R. longifolius plants was morphologically identical to that on originally diseased plants. Similar results were obtained from three independent

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: diseased plants. Similar results were obtained from three independent pathogenicity tests. Based on the morphological and molecular characterization, the powdery mildew fungus was identified as E. polygoni. Although powdery mildew caused by E. polygoni has been reported on R.

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: powdery mildew caused by E. polygoni has been reported on R. longifolius (synonym R. domesticus) in Finland, Romania, South Korea, and Sweden (Braun 1995; Cho and Shin 2004), this is the first report of E. polygoni on R. longifolius in China. This work expands the

metadata.title: First Report of Powdery Mildew on Rumex longifolius Caused by Erysiphe polygoni in China.
metadata.authors: Fang Z; Zhang J; Yin C; Tan L; Weng Q

documents.content: polygoni on R. longifolius in China. This work expands the geographical range of E. polygoni on R. longifolius plants.

metadata.authors: Kopperud BT; Höhna S

documents.content: rates. A common approach in neontological studies is to use a phylogenetic birth-death process to model species diversification. Specifically, the birth-death-shift process is used to model branch-specific shifts in the tempo of diversification. Here, we present Pesto, a new method and software

metadata.title: Phylogenetic Estimation of Branch-specific Shifts in the Tempo of Origination.
metadata.authors: Kopperud BT; Höhna S

documents.content: of diversification. Here, we present Pesto, a new method and software that estimates branch-specific diversification rates using an empirical Bayes approach. Pesto does not rely on Markov chain Monte Carlo simulations and instead deterministically computes the posterior mean branch-specific

metadata.title: Phylogenetic Estimation of Branch-specific Shifts in the Tempo of Origination.
metadata.authors: Kopperud BT; Höhna S

documents.content: and instead deterministically computes the posterior mean branch-specific diversification rates using only two traversals of the tree. This method is blazingly fast: the birth-death-shift model can be fitted to large phylogenies (>20k taxa) in minutes on a personal computer while also providing

metadata.title: Phylogenetic Estimation of Branch-specific Shifts in the Tempo of Origination.
metadata.authors: Kopperud BT; Höhna S

documents.content: (>20k taxa) in minutes on a personal computer while also providing branch-specific inference of diversification rate shift events. Thus, we can robustly infer branch-specific diversification rates and the number of diversification rate shift events for large-scale phylogenies, as well as exploring

metadata.title: Phylogenetic Estimation of Branch-specific Shifts in the Tempo of Origination.
metadata.authors: Kopperud BT; Höhna S

documents.content: rate shift events for large-scale phylogenies, as well as exploring the characteristics of the birth-death-shift model through complex and large-scale simulations. Here, we first describe the method and the software implementation Pesto and explore its behavior using trees simulated under the

metadata.title: Phylogenetic Estimation of Branch-specific Shifts in the Tempo of Origination.
metadata.authors: Kopperud BT; Höhna S

documents.content: Pesto and explore its behavior using trees simulated under the birth-death-shift model. Then, we explore the behavior of inferring significant branch-specific diversification rate shifts using both Bayes factors and effect sizes. We find few to no false positive inferences of diversification rate

metadata.title: Phylogenetic Estimation of Branch-specific Shifts in the Tempo of Origination.
metadata.authors: Kopperud BT; Höhna S

documents.content: sizes. We find few to no false positive inferences of diversification rate shift events but many false negatives (reduced power). The most difficult parameter to estimate is the rate at which diversification rate shifts occur. Despite this, branch-specific diversification rate estimates are precise

metadata.title: Phylogenetic Estimation of Branch-specific Shifts in the Tempo of Origination.
metadata.authors: Kopperud BT; Höhna S

documents.content: Despite this, branch-specific diversification rate estimates are precise and nearly unbiased.

documents.content: Advances in diagnosing and managing fetal anomalies have enabled the rapid evolution of maternal-fetal surgery (MFS). documents.content: Crystal-storing histiocytosis is a rare condition characterized by the accumulation of crystalline immunoglobulins within histiocytes, often associated with plasma cell disorders such as multiple myeloma. metadata.title: Crystal-Storing Histiocytosis of the Duodenum in a Patient With IgG-Lambda Multiple Myeloma.
metadata.authors: Koga S; Yang Z; Alipour Z

documents.content: with gastrointestinal bleeding. Endoscopy revealed nodular erythematous mucosa in the duodenum, and biopsies showed histiocytosis in the lamina propria. metadata.title: Crystal-Storing Histiocytosis of the Duodenum in a Patient With IgG-Lambda Multiple Myeloma.
metadata.authors: Koga S; Yang Z; Alipour Z

documents.content: diastase-resistant intracellular material. Differential diagnoses, including Whipple disease,

metadata.title: Crystal-Storing Histiocytosis of the Duodenum in a Patient With IgG-Lambda Multiple Myeloma.
metadata.authors: Koga S; Yang Z; Alipour Z

documents.content: histiocytosis. Differential diagnoses, including Whipple disease, mycobacterial infections, lanthanum deposition, amyloidosis, and xanthoma, were excluded based on histological findings and clinical history. documents.content: Platelets are frequently transfused, but supply and potential harms highlight the importance of appropriate use. Our systematic review (SR) followed a predefined protocol. Populations included were hypoproliferative thrombocytopenia, periprocedural prophylaxis, cardiovascular surgery, consumptive thrombocytopenia, and intracranial hemorrhage. The intervention was restrictive versus

metadata.title: The clinical use of platelet transfusions: A systematic literature review and meta-analysis on behalf of the International Collaboration for Transfusion Medicine Guidelines.

documents.content: and intracranial hemorrhage. The intervention was restrictive versus liberal platelet transfusion strategies on outcomes of mortality and bleeding. Duplicate screening and data extraction occurred. Meta-analysis used Mantel-Haenszel method of random effects model. Twenty-one RCTs, 24 observational

metadata.title: The clinical use of platelet transfusions: A systematic literature review and meta-analysis on behalf of the International Collaboration for Transfusion Medicine Guidelines.
metadata.authors: Jug R; La Rocca U; Al-Riyami AZ; Bathla A; Metcalf RA; White SK; Stanworth SJ; Nahirniak S

documents.content: method of random effects model. Twenty-one RCTs, 24 observational studies, and 20 SRs were included. The evidence quality varied. For hypoproliferative thrombocytopenia, 11 RCTs were analyzed, with 9 RCTs at moderate risk of bias (ROB). Two RCTs were identified for dengue, with high ROB for

metadata.title: The clinical use of platelet transfusions: A systematic literature review and meta-analysis on behalf of the International Collaboration for Transfusion Medicine Guidelines.
metadata.authors: Jug R; La Rocca U; Al-Riyami AZ; Bathla A; Metcalf RA; White SK; Stanworth SJ; Nahirniak S

documents.content: risk of bias (ROB). Two RCTs were identified for dengue, with high ROB for bleeding. One RCT was identified each in cardiovascular surgery, intracranial hemorrhage, and periprocedural prophylaxis. Meta-analyses indicated no significant effect for outcomes of mortality or bleeding by strategy, but

metadata.title: The clinical use of platelet transfusions: A systematic literature review and meta-analysis on behalf of the International Collaboration for Transfusion Medicine Guidelines.

documents.content: significant effect for outcomes of mortality or bleeding by strategy, but confidence intervals (CIs) were wide. documents.content: Semi-supervised learning uses labeled and unlabeled data from known classes for training, assuming the test data contains only those classes. metadata.title: Generalized Category Discovery with Unknown Sample Generation.

documents.content: (GCD) extends SSL to handle unlabeled samples that may belong to both known and unknown categories. metadata.title: Generalized Category Discovery with Unknown Sample Generation.

documents.content: to address the GCD problem, called Generalized Category Discovery with Unknown Sample Generation (GCDUSG). documents.content: numbers and pseudo-labels for unlabeled samples, thereby enabling us to learn the unknown prototypes. documents.content: between known and unknown prototypes. We generate realistic and discriminative unknown samples leveraging the known-unknown relationships. We achieve this by minimizing the class-wise Maximum Mean Discrepancy distance between the generated samples and the selected unknown samples. To account for

metadata.title: Generalized Category Discovery with Unknown Sample Generation.

documents.content: the generated samples and the selected unknown samples. To account for the pseudo-labels assigned to unlabeled samples, we train a classifier using all samples, incorporating a pseudo-label supervision loss to mitigate the impact of potentially erroneous labels. This comprehensive training equips

metadata.title: Generalized Category Discovery with Unknown Sample Generation.

documents.content: impact of potentially erroneous labels. This comprehensive training equips the classifier to effectively handle both known and unknown classes during testing. Extensive experiments conducted on benchmark datasets demonstrate the effectiveness of our approach.

documents.content: Tracking forearm movement via measured physiological signals is crucial for understanding human motor control mechanism. Current methods mainly use muscle-derived signals to predict arm movements while often overlooking the potential role of gaze attention, which is important for hand-eye

metadata.title: Hierarchical Transformer Fusion of Gaze Attention and Muscle Activity for Forearm Movement Estimation.
metadata.authors: Lan B; Stramigioli S; Niu K

documents.content: the potential role of gaze attention, which is important for hand-eye coordination and instant and continuous motion planning and execution. In this study, we explored the impact of gaze on motion tracking. A hierarchical transformer-based structure was developed to integrate gaze into muscle

metadata.title: Hierarchical Transformer Fusion of Gaze Attention and Muscle Activity for Forearm Movement Estimation.
metadata.authors: Lan B; Stramigioli S; Niu K

documents.content: transformer-based structure was developed to integrate gaze into muscle activity signals for recovering the joint trajectory. To collect the dataset, six subjects were recruited to perform arm motions broadly involved in daily activities; the measured signals from the muscle activity and gaze

metadata.title: Hierarchical Transformer Fusion of Gaze Attention and Muscle Activity for Forearm Movement Estimation.
metadata.authors: Lan B; Stramigioli S; Niu K

documents.content: daily activities; the measured signals from the muscle activity and gaze attention were used to train and evaluate the proposed method. A performance comparison was conducted between the models using solely muscle activity signals and both muscle and gaze information. The experimental results

metadata.title: Hierarchical Transformer Fusion of Gaze Attention and Muscle Activity for Forearm Movement Estimation.
metadata.authors: Lan B; Stramigioli S; Niu K

documents.content: signals and both muscle and gaze information. The experimental results showed the important role of gaze information involved in motion prediction and the motor control mechanism. This research also gained insights on how to integrate gaze information into the muscle signals, which offers an

metadata.title: Hierarchical Transformer Fusion of Gaze Attention and Muscle Activity for Forearm Movement Estimation.
metadata.authors: Lan B; Stramigioli S; Niu K

documents.content: how to integrate gaze information into the muscle signals, which offers an alternative to bringing artificial intelligence to be engaged in the framework of motion tracking. Consequently, it is important for future designs of biomechanical sensors and wearable robotics systems.

documents.content: Open-set domain adaptation (OSDA) seeks to transfer knowledge from a labeled source domain to an unlabeled target domain containing novel classes. Traditional OSDA methods rarely account for the uncertainty in predictions and typically require additional training overhead. Evidential deep learning

metadata.title: Evidential Deep Learning for Open-Set Active Domain Adaptation.
metadata.authors: Tian Q; Yu J; Zhao Y; Li W; Lei Z
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: typically require additional training overhead. Evidential deep learning (EDL) transforms the model's predictions from point estimates to distributions over the probability simplex by replacing the standard softmax output of classification neural networks with Dirichlet distributions. Considering

metadata.title: Evidential Deep Learning for Open-Set Active Domain Adaptation.
metadata.authors: Tian Q; Yu J; Zhao Y; Li W; Lei Z
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: classification neural networks with Dirichlet distributions. Considering the presence of out-of-distribution novel classes in OSDA and the additional overhead of existing methods, we propose EDL for open-set active domain adaptation (EOSADA). Leveraging EDL, we construct an open-set classifier and

metadata.title: Evidential Deep Learning for Open-Set Active Domain Adaptation.
metadata.authors: Tian Q; Yu J; Zhao Y; Li W; Lei Z
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: (EOSADA). Leveraging EDL, we construct an open-set classifier and employ a two-round selection strategy guided by the data uncertainty of target domain samples and semantic similarity scores with known classes. This strategy balances the selection of samples from known and novel classes while

metadata.title: Evidential Deep Learning for Open-Set Active Domain Adaptation.
metadata.authors: Tian Q; Yu J; Zhao Y; Li W; Lei Z
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: balances the selection of samples from known and novel classes while identifying informative samples, thereby maximizing the performance of the model in OSDA scenarios without modifying the model structure and utilizing a limited annotation budget. Extensive experiments demonstrate the superiority

metadata.title: Evidential Deep Learning for Open-Set Active Domain Adaptation.
metadata.authors: Tian Q; Yu J; Zhao Y; Li W; Lei Z
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: annotation budget. Extensive experiments demonstrate the superiority of our approach.

documents.content: Fault transfer diagnosis is a key technology to ensure the reliability and safety of industrial systems, the core of which is to identify the health status of the equipment among different working conditions with multiclassification methods. However, most of them are based on a closed-set assumption

metadata.title: Knowledge Transfer and Reinforcement Based on Biunbiased Neural Network: A Novel Solution for Open-Set Fault Transfer Diagnosis.
metadata.authors: Wang L; Zhang H; Liu J; Zuo F
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: methods. However, most of them are based on a closed-set assumption that the label space among different working conditions is consistent, which is hard to satisfy in a practical industrial environment as unknown faults would inevitably occur during operation, i.e., the open-set fault transfer

metadata.title: Knowledge Transfer and Reinforcement Based on Biunbiased Neural Network: A Novel Solution for Open-Set Fault Transfer Diagnosis.
metadata.authors: Wang L; Zhang H; Liu J; Zuo F
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: would inevitably occur during operation, i.e., the open-set fault transfer diagnosis (OSFTD) problem. Moreover, during the transfer process, unnecessary source-specific knowledge tends to be adapted, which brings about biased diagnostics on both domain and category. Aiming at this issue, an OSFTD

metadata.title: Knowledge Transfer and Reinforcement Based on Biunbiased Neural Network: A Novel Solution for Open-Set Fault Transfer Diagnosis.
metadata.authors: Wang L; Zhang H; Liu J; Zuo F
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: diagnostics on both domain and category. Aiming at this issue, an OSFTD framework, coined as knowledge transfer and reinforcement based on biunbiased neural network (KTR-BUNN), is proposed. First, a domain-unbiased knowledge transfer subnet is proposed, including an uncertainty-aware fault

metadata.title: Knowledge Transfer and Reinforcement Based on Biunbiased Neural Network: A Novel Solution for Open-Set Fault Transfer Diagnosis.
metadata.authors: Wang L; Zhang H; Liu J; Zuo F
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: transfer subnet is proposed, including an uncertainty-aware fault transferability evaluator (FTE) that estimates the transferability of target-domain samples unbiasedly to guide distribution alignment of known faults and a triple-tier unknown fault separator (UFS) that takes transferability as the

metadata.title: Knowledge Transfer and Reinforcement Based on Biunbiased Neural Network: A Novel Solution for Open-Set Fault Transfer Diagnosis.
metadata.authors: Wang L; Zhang H; Liu J; Zuo F
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: unknown fault separator (UFS) that takes transferability as the criterion to extrapolate unknown faults. Second, a class-unbiased knowledge reinforcement subnet is designed to promote the recognition of fault semantic features at the embedding space, where fault knowledge graphs (FKGs) are

metadata.title: Knowledge Transfer and Reinforcement Based on Biunbiased Neural Network: A Novel Solution for Open-Set Fault Transfer Diagnosis.
metadata.authors: Wang L; Zhang H; Liu J; Zuo F
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: features at the embedding space, where fault knowledge graphs (FKGs) are constructed to describe the relationships between fault types, and they are optimized by a contrastive fault correlation loss, so that fine-grained class-level fault features can be further aligned. The knowledge transfer and

metadata.title: Knowledge Transfer and Reinforcement Based on Biunbiased Neural Network: A Novel Solution for Open-Set Fault Transfer Diagnosis.
metadata.authors: Wang L; Zhang H; Liu J; Zuo F
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: fault features can be further aligned. The knowledge transfer and knowledge reinforcement mechanisms work jointly to facilitate the performance of OSFTD. Finally, extensive experimental results conducted on diverse diagnostic tasks illustrate the superiority of the proposed KTR-BUNN.

metadata.title: Knowledge Transfer and Reinforcement Based on Biunbiased Neural Network: A Novel Solution for Open-Set Fault Transfer Diagnosis.
metadata.authors: Wang L; Zhang H; Liu J; Zuo F
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

metadata.title: Parallel Multistep Evaluation With Efficient Data Utilization for Safe Neural Critic Control and Its Application to Orbital Maneuver Systems.

documents.content: Spiking neural networks (SNNs) have garnered interest due to their energy efficiency and superior effectiveness on neuromorphic chips compared with traditional artificial neural networks (ANNs). One of the mainstream approaches to implementing deep SNNs is the ANN-SNN conversion, which integrates

metadata.title: Converting High-Performance and Low-Latency SNNs Through Explicit Modeling of Residual Error in ANNs.
metadata.authors: Huang Z; Ding J; Pan Z; Li H; Fang Y; Yu Z; Liu JK
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: to implementing deep SNNs is the ANN-SNN conversion, which integrates the efficient training strategy of ANNs with the energy-saving potential and fast inference capability of SNNs. However, under extremely low-latency conditions, the existing conversion theory suggests that the problem of SNNs'

metadata.title: Converting High-Performance and Low-Latency SNNs Through Explicit Modeling of Residual Error in ANNs.
metadata.authors: Huang Z; Ding J; Pan Z; Li H; Fang Y; Yu Z; Liu JK
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: the existing conversion theory suggests that the problem of SNNs' neurons firing more or fewer spikes within each layer, i.e., residual error, leads to a performance gap in the converted SNNs compared with the original ANNs. This severely limits the possibility of the practical application of SNNs

metadata.title: Converting High-Performance and Low-Latency SNNs Through Explicit Modeling of Residual Error in ANNs.
metadata.authors: Huang Z; Ding J; Pan Z; Li H; Fang Y; Yu Z; Liu JK
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: This severely limits the possibility of the practical application of SNNs on delay-sensitive edge devices. Existing conversion methods addressing this problem usually involve modifying the state of the conversion spiking neurons. However, these methods do not consider their adaptability and

metadata.title: Converting High-Performance and Low-Latency SNNs Through Explicit Modeling of Residual Error in ANNs.
metadata.authors: Huang Z; Ding J; Pan Z; Li H; Fang Y; Yu Z; Liu JK
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: neurons. However, these methods do not consider their adaptability and compatibility with neuromorphic chips. We propose a new approach based on explicit modeling of residual errors as additive noise. The noise is incorporated into the activation function of the source ANN, effectively reducing the

metadata.title: Converting High-Performance and Low-Latency SNNs Through Explicit Modeling of Residual Error in ANNs.
metadata.authors: Huang Z; Ding J; Pan Z; Li H; Fang Y; Yu Z; Liu JK
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: into the activation function of the source ANN, effectively reducing the impact of residual error on SNN performance. Our experiments on the CIFAR10/100 and Tiny-ImageNet datasets verify that our approach exceeds the prevailing ANN-SNN conversion methods and directly trained SNNs concerning

metadata.title: Converting High-Performance and Low-Latency SNNs Through Explicit Modeling of Residual Error in ANNs.
metadata.authors: Huang Z; Ding J; Pan Z; Li H; Fang Y; Yu Z; Liu JK
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: prevailing ANN-SNN conversion methods and directly trained SNNs concerning accuracy and the required time steps. Overall, our method provides new ideas for improving SNN performance under ultralow-latency conditions and is expected to promote practical neuromorphic hardware applications for further

metadata.title: Converting High-Performance and Low-Latency SNNs Through Explicit Modeling of Residual Error in ANNs.
metadata.authors: Huang Z; Ding J; Pan Z; Li H; Fang Y; Yu Z; Liu JK
metadata.journal: IEEE transactions on neural networks and learning systems

documents.content: to promote practical neuromorphic hardware applications for further development. The code for our NQ framework is available at https://github.com/hzp2022/ANN2SNN_NQ.

documents.content: Peptides can serve as building blocks for supramolecular materials because of their unique ability to self-assemble, offering potential applications in drug delivery, tissue engineering, and nanotechnology. In this review, we describe peptide self-assembly as a sequence- and context-dependent

metadata.title: Using Machine Learning to Fast-Track Peptide Nanomaterial Discovery.
metadata.authors: Dražić E; Jelušić D; Janković Bevandić P; Mauša G; Kalafatovic D

documents.content: we describe peptide self-assembly as a sequence- and context-dependent process and its resulting complexity due to the heterogeneity of the sequences and experimental conditions, which makes cross-laboratory reproducibility a serious challenge and standardized reporting a necessity. Given the large

metadata.title: Using Machine Learning to Fast-Track Peptide Nanomaterial Discovery.
metadata.authors: Dražić E; Jelušić D; Janković Bevandić P; Mauša G; Kalafatovic D

documents.content: serious challenge and standardized reporting a necessity. Given the large number of possible peptide permutations, machine learning (ML) is suitable for navigating the peptide search space with the aim of reducing trial-and-error experimentation and speeding up the discovery of self-assembling

metadata.title: Using Machine Learning to Fast-Track Peptide Nanomaterial Discovery.
metadata.authors: Dražić E; Jelušić D; Janković Bevandić P; Mauša G; Kalafatovic D

documents.content: experimentation and speeding up the discovery of self-assembling peptides. However, we point out that ML is not a point-and-shoot tool that can be applied directly to any problem and requires careful consideration, domain knowledge, and proper data preparation to achieve meaningful results. In

metadata.title: Using Machine Learning to Fast-Track Peptide Nanomaterial Discovery.
metadata.authors: Dražić E; Jelušić D; Janković Bevandić P; Mauša G; Kalafatovic D

documents.content: knowledge, and proper data preparation to achieve meaningful results. In addition, we discuss the lack of negative data reported to be the main limiting factor in the effective application of ML. Considering the transformative potential of artificial intelligence, we conclude that grasping the

metadata.title: Using Machine Learning to Fast-Track Peptide Nanomaterial Discovery.
metadata.authors: Dražić E; Jelušić D; Janković Bevandić P; Mauša G; Kalafatovic D

documents.content: potential of artificial intelligence, we conclude that grasping the power of large language models and generative approaches, coupled with explainability techniques, will expedite peptide nanomaterials discovery.

documents.content: Natural ice plays salient roles in making the Earth habitable and sustainable. Previously overlooked, its role in chemical processes is now of emerging interest, particularly due to the freeze concentration effect, which can substantially promote chemical reactions during ice formation. We

metadata.title: Freeze-induced crystallization: An overlooked pathway for mineral genesis in natural waters.
metadata.authors: Won Y; Lee S; Lee S; Park S; Lim J; Choi W; Lee G
metadata.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America

documents.content: can substantially promote chemical reactions during ice formation. We demonstrate here that ice formation can serve as a dynamic and unique pathway for mineral genesis. Freezing solutions containing dissolved manganese and carbonates produced rhodochrosite (Mn<sup>II</sup>CO<sub>3</sub>) even under

metadata.title: Freeze-induced crystallization: An overlooked pathway for mineral genesis in natural waters.
metadata.authors: Won Y; Lee S; Lee S; Park S; Lim J; Choi W; Lee G
metadata.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America

documents.content: produced rhodochrosite (Mn<sup>II</sup>CO<sub>3</sub>) even under slightly undersaturated conditions. At room temperature, by contrast, this occurred when the solution saturation level was increased by ca. 30,000 times. The cryogenic rhodochrosite formed spherical aggregates of

metadata.title: Freeze-induced crystallization: An overlooked pathway for mineral genesis in natural waters.
metadata.authors: Won Y; Lee S; Lee S; Park S; Lim J; Choi W; Lee G
metadata.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America

documents.content: 30,000 times. The cryogenic rhodochrosite formed spherical aggregates of nano-polycrystallites, distinctly different from the cubic monocrystalline particles observed at room temperature. The distinct feature likely resulted from the combined effects of the intensified supersaturation induced by

metadata.title: Freeze-induced crystallization: An overlooked pathway for mineral genesis in natural waters.

metadata.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America

documents.content: from the combined effects of the intensified supersaturation induced by the freeze concentration effect and the low temperatures within liquid-like layers, conditions that make liquid-like layers an exceptional environment for mineral genesis, unlike typical natural water systems. The cryogenic

metadata.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America

documents.content: for mineral genesis, unlike typical natural water systems. The cryogenic rhodochrosite formation was successfully demonstrated using in situ, real-time X-ray absorption spectroscopy (XAS), enabling direct observation of freeze-induced solid formation. Our findings reveal that freeze-induced

metadata.title: Freeze-induced crystallization: An overlooked pathway for mineral genesis in natural waters.

metadata.journal: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America

documents.content: A minority of PD cases are familial and are caused by a single genetic mutation. One of the most common PD-causing genes is leucine-rich repeat kinase 2 (LRRK2), which causes an autosomal dominant PD that presents very similarly to sporadic PD. Pathogenic mutations in LRRK2 increase its kinase

documents.content: Due to its anti-inflammatory effects, doxycycline is widely used in the treatment of various dermatological diseases. This retrospective study included 72 patients who were prescribed doxycycline treatment. The severity of acne was assessed using the

metadata.title: The effect of systemic doxycycline treatment on hematological inflammatory parameters in patients with acne vulgaris.
metadata.authors: Celik MS; Celik C

documents.content: doxycycline treatment. The severity of acne was assessed using the Global Acne Grading System (GAGS). Hematological parameters (NLR, PLR, MLR, MPV, and SII) were recorded and analyzed at baseline (month 0), during treatment (month 1), and at the second month of treatment. A significant decrease in

metadata.title: The effect of systemic doxycycline treatment on hematological inflammatory parameters in patients with acne vulgaris.
metadata.authors: Celik MS; Celik C

documents.content: (month 1), and at the second month of treatment. A significant decrease in NLR, PLR, and SII values was observed during doxycycline treatment. The initial NLR value was 2.24 ± 1.69, which decreased significantly to 1.59 ± 0.575 in the second month (p = 0.002). The initial SII value was

metadata.title: The effect of systemic doxycycline treatment on hematological inflammatory parameters in patients with acne vulgaris.
metadata.authors: Celik MS; Celik C

documents.content: in the second month (p = 0.002). The initial SII value was 640 ± 593, which also decreased significantly to 432 ± 277 in the second month (p = 0.004). The initial Global Acne Grading Score (GAGS) was 26.3 ± 5.40, decreasing significantly to 21.9 ± 5.78 by the second month

metadata.title: The effect of systemic doxycycline treatment on hematological inflammatory parameters in patients with acne vulgaris.
metadata.authors: Celik MS; Celik C

documents.content: 26.3 ± 5.40, decreasing significantly to 21.9 ± 5.78 by the second month (p < 0.001). Additionally, NLR, PLR, and SII values showed a significant positive correlation with the Global Acne Grading Score (GAGS) both at baseline (month 0) and after treatment (month 2). NLR exhibited the

metadata.title: The effect of systemic doxycycline treatment on hematological inflammatory parameters in patients with acne vulgaris.
metadata.authors: Celik MS; Celik C

documents.content: at baseline (month 0) and after treatment (month 2). NLR exhibited the strongest relationship with GAGS (p < 0.001). This study demonstrates that doxycycline treatment significantly reduces inflammatory response markers, including NLR, PLR, and SII. The significant decrease in GAGS scores,

metadata.title: The effect of systemic doxycycline treatment on hematological inflammatory parameters in patients with acne vulgaris.
metadata.authors: Celik MS; Celik C

documents.content: including NLR, PLR, and SII. The significant decrease in GAGS scores, along with NLR, PLR, and SII, confirms the inflammatory role of these markers. Further large-scale, controlled studies are needed to better understand the systemic anti-inflammatory effects of doxycycline.

documents.content: This study investigates the evolution of hospital development in Saskatchewan during the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries. documents.content: The diagnosis and perception of autism have undergone significant transformations throughout history. Initially conceptualised as a symptom of schizophrenia, autism later emerged as a distinct diagnosis, evolving into the broader classification of autism spectrum disorder (ASD). This essay explores

metadata.title: History of the Autism Diagnosis- How the Perspectives Have Changed.
metadata.authors: Lang HM
metadata.journal: Health care analysis : HCA : journal of health philosophy and policy

documents.content: classification of autism spectrum disorder (ASD). This essay explores the main shifts in the understanding of autism throughout its history and different approaches to its treatment. While the traditional psychiatric perspective aligns with a naturalist view of disease, the Neurodiversity Movement

metadata.title: History of the Autism Diagnosis- How the Perspectives Have Changed.
metadata.authors: Lang HM
metadata.journal: Health care analysis : HCA : journal of health philosophy and policy

documents.content: aligns with a naturalist view of disease, the Neurodiversity Movement advocates for a normative approach, emphasising societal adaptation over medical intervention. The study examines historical milestones, including the contributions of Eugen Bleuler, Grunya Sukhareva, Leo Kanner, and Hans

metadata.title: History of the Autism Diagnosis- How the Perspectives Have Changed.
metadata.authors: Lang HM
metadata.journal: Health care analysis : HCA : journal of health philosophy and policy

documents.content: the contributions of Eugen Bleuler, Grunya Sukhareva, Leo Kanner, and Hans Asperger, alongside the conceptual transition from low- and high-functioning autism to the spectrum model. It also discusses the implications of language in shaping autism discourse, highlighting the shift from person-first

metadata.title: History of the Autism Diagnosis- How the Perspectives Have Changed.
metadata.authors: Lang HM
metadata.journal: Health care analysis : HCA : journal of health philosophy and policy

documents.content: in shaping autism discourse, highlighting the shift from person-first to identity-first terminology. The essay ultimately argues that the expansion of the autism diagnosis supports the neurodiversity paradigm, which fosters greater inclusion and empowerment of neurodivergent individuals. However,

metadata.title: History of the Autism Diagnosis- How the Perspectives Have Changed.
metadata.authors: Lang HM
metadata.journal: Health care analysis : HCA : journal of health philosophy and policy

documents.content: greater inclusion and empowerment of neurodivergent individuals. However, considerations of severity and linguistic framing remain crucial in advancing this perspective.

documents.content: Vagal nerve stimulation (VNS) is a form of neuromodulation that is an established adjunct in the management of drug-resistant epilepsy. The common side effects of VNS are cough, dysphonia, or shortness of breath, which are often mild and do not require discontinuation of therapy. However, serious

metadata.title: Late-onset asystole associated with vagal nerve stimulation.

However, serious adverse effects such as bradyarrhythmia and asystole can occur rarely in patients who have had VNS implanted several years ago due to certain technical issues, patient-related risk factors, and unknown causes that

metadata.title: Late-onset asystole associated with vagal nerve stimulation.
metadata.authors: Nagabushana D; Huynh H; McCauley MD; Serafini A

documents.content: technical issues, patient-related risk factors, and unknown causes that necessitate the deactivation of VNS. We describe the late onset of bradyarrhythmia in a 32-year-old patient with drug-resistant epilepsy 2 years after the implantation of VNS and the subsequent management. We also review

metadata.title: Late-onset asystole associated with vagal nerve stimulation.
metadata.authors: Nagabushana D; Huynh H; McCauley MD; Serafini A

documents.content: the implantation of VNS and the subsequent management. We also review similar cases in the literature to understand their mechanism of asystole and the antecedent risk factors. In conclusion, when selecting a patient for VNS, all the possible risk factors for adverse cardiac events should be

metadata.title: Late-onset asystole associated with vagal nerve stimulation.

Initial EKG Holter prior to implantation and periodic monitoring is recommended for patients on VNS. documents.content: Survivors of cancer are at increased risk of food insecurity, especially post-COVID-19. However, data are scant regarding this issue in this group. This study assessed the prevalence and correlates of food insecurity in a national sample of survivors of cancer in the United States. Using data from

metadata.title: Beyond survival: food insecurity challenges for survivors of cancer post-COVID.
metadata.authors: Bhurosy T; Abraham FO; Reblin M; Niu Z; Chung T

documents.content: sample of survivors of cancer in the United States. Using data from the 2022 Health Information National Trends Survey (N = 840), this study examined food insecurity among survivors of cancer through questions on meal size, skipping meals, and affordability of balanced meals. Correlates included

metadata.title: Beyond survival: food insecurity challenges for survivors of cancer post-COVID.
metadata.authors: Bhurosy T; Abraham FO; Reblin M; Niu Z; Chung T

documents.content: skipping meals, and affordability of balanced meals. Correlates included patient-provider communication and sociodemographic factors. Binary logistic regressions were conducted using the jackknife replication method on STATA. About 7% of survivors of cancer reported cutting meal sizes or skipping

metadata.title: Beyond survival: food insecurity challenges for survivors of cancer post-COVID.
metadata.authors: Bhurosy T; Abraham FO; Reblin M; Niu Z; Chung T

documents.content: About 7% of survivors of cancer reported cutting meal sizes or skipping meals, while about 9% could not afford balanced meals. Better patient-provider communication was associated with lower odds of cutting meal sizes [Odds Ratio (OR) 0.87; 95% Confidence Interval (CI) 0.77, 0.98) and not being

metadata.title: Beyond survival: food insecurity challenges for survivors of cancer post-COVID.
metadata.authors: Bhurosy T; Abraham FO; Reblin M; Niu Z; Chung T

documents.content: Ratio (OR) 0.87; 95% Confidence Interval (CI) 0.77, 0.98) and not being able to afford balanced meals (OR 0.85; 95% CI 0.76, 0.95). Older survivors (aged 61 +) were less likely to cut meal sizes or skip them (OR 0.02; 95% CI 0.00090, 0.50) compared to younger survivors aged 18-40. Specific at-risk

metadata.title: Beyond survival: food insecurity challenges for survivors of cancer post-COVID.
metadata.authors: Bhurosy T; Abraham FO; Reblin M; Niu Z; Chung T

documents.content: 0.00090, 0.50) compared to younger survivors aged 18-40. Specific at-risk subgroups included those who did not complete high school and divorced or single individuals. Certain cancer survivors, such as those with lower educational level, those who are divorced or single, and those who are young,

metadata.title: Beyond survival: food insecurity challenges for survivors of cancer post-COVID.

documents.content: Animal mediated pollination is one of the most ecologically and economically important mutualisms and serves as a remarkable example of cross-kingdom communication and coevolution. Unfortunately pollinators, plants, and the interactions between them are threatened in the Anthropocene. While

metadata.title: Plant-pollinator interactions in the Anthropocene: why we need a systems approach.
metadata.authors: Sprayberry JDH; Ashman TL; Crall J; Hranitz J; Jankauski M; Lihoreau M; Potdar S; Rafferty NE; Rittschof CC; Smith MA; Valdes I; Westerman EL

documents.content: the interactions between them are threatened in the Anthropocene. While pollination emerges from interactions across biological scales, existing research and expertise have developed in distinct silos reflecting traditional fields of study such as ecology, plant physiology, neuroethology, etc. This

metadata.title: Plant-pollinator interactions in the Anthropocene: why we need a systems approach.
metadata.authors: Sprayberry JDH; Ashman TL; Crall J; Hranitz J; Jankauski M; Lihoreau M; Potdar S; Rafferty NE; Rittschof CC; Smith MA; Valdes I; Westerman EL

documents.content: of study such as ecology, plant physiology, neuroethology, etc. This forward-looking review and perspective is a culmination of the "Plant-pollinator interactions in the Anthropocene" symposium at the 2025 Society for Integrative and Comparative Biology meeting, which collected expertise across

metadata.title: Plant-pollinator interactions in the Anthropocene: why we need a systems approach.
metadata.authors: Sprayberry JDH; Ashman TL; Crall J; Hranitz J; Jankauski M; Lihoreau M; Potdar S; Rafferty NE; Rittschof CC; Smith MA; Valdes I; Westerman EL

documents.content: and Comparative Biology meeting, which collected expertise across these disciplinary silos to identify pressing questions our community needs to tackle in the next decade. In this perspective piece we argue that an integrative, organismally-informed systems approach is critical to unraveling the

metadata.title: Plant-pollinator interactions in the Anthropocene: why we need a systems approach.
metadata.authors: Sprayberry JDH; Ashman TL; Crall J; Hranitz J; Jankauski M; Lihoreau M; Potdar S; Rafferty NE; Rittschof CC; Smith MA; Valdes I; Westerman EL

documents.content: organismally-informed systems approach is critical to unraveling the complexity of how plant-pollinator relationships are impacted by dynamic anthropogenic stressors. Specifically, this calls for an intentional and iterative integration of holistic modelling studies with empirical studies.

metadata.title: Plant-pollinator interactions in the Anthropocene: why we need a systems approach.
metadata.authors: Sprayberry JDH; Ashman TL; Crall J; Hranitz J; Jankauski M; Lihoreau M; Potdar S; Rafferty NE; Rittschof CC; Smith MA; Valdes I; Westerman EL

Modelling the emergent properties driven by organismal-interactions in pollination-systems can identify impactful variables; this in turn should drive design of empirical studies that elucidate how organisms respond to changing

metadata.title: Plant-pollinator interactions in the Anthropocene: why we need a systems approach.

documents.content: Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) is the most common metabolic and endocrine disorder affecting women of reproductive age. This condition is characterized by the presence of polycystic ovarian morphology, anovulation, and clinical or biochemical manifestations of hyperandrogenism. Numerous patients

documents.content: Gender disparities in emotional exhaustion and burnout are well-recognized, but few studies have assessed gender differences in EHR patient portal workload and implications for clinician well-being. To investigate gender differences in EHR in basket activity, workload, and burnout among physicians.

metadata.title: The Gender Gap in EHR Workload: A Comparative Analysis of Primary Care Physician In Basket Usage.
metadata.authors: Branford GL; Bucala MD; Hepper A; Hadeed NM; Northway RM; Brenner MJ

documents.content: in EHR in basket activity, workload, and burnout among physicians. Observational analysis of EHR usage data and survey responses. 406 physicians (43.1% men, 56.9% women) at a large academic medical center. Time spent on EHR activities, including in basket tasks, orders, and notes. Survey responses

metadata.title: The Gender Gap in EHR Workload: A Comparative Analysis of Primary Care Physician In Basket Usage.
metadata.authors: Branford GL; Bucala MD; Hepper A; Hadeed NM; Northway RM; Brenner MJ

documents.content: activities, including in basket tasks, orders, and notes. Survey responses were collected on factors contributing to burnout, experiences with patient portal messages, and perceptions of EHR usability. Women physicians spent significantly more time on orders (34.00 vs 28.39 min/day, p = 0.004) and

metadata.title: The Gender Gap in EHR Workload: A Comparative Analysis of Primary Care Physician In Basket Usage.
metadata.authors: Branford GL; Bucala MD; Hepper A; Hadeed NM; Northway RM; Brenner MJ

documents.content: significantly more time on orders (34.00 vs 28.39 min/day, p = 0.004) and notes (70.38 vs 53.17 min/day, p = 0.004) than men physicians. Women physicians were more likely to report that patient portal messages required more clinical assessment (OR = 1.60, 95% CI: 1.05-2.45, p = 0.0297) and

metadata.title: The Gender Gap in EHR Workload: A Comparative Analysis of Primary Care Physician In Basket Usage.
metadata.authors: Branford GL; Bucala MD; Hepper A; Hadeed NM; Northway RM; Brenner MJ

documents.content: more clinical assessment (OR = 1.60, 95% CI: 1.05-2.45, p = 0.0297) and contributed to burnout (OR = 1.76, 95% CI: 1.12-2.79, p = 0.0152). They were also more likely to receive negative messages from patients (OR = 1.61, 95% CI: 1.08-2.42, p = 0.0204). Interestingly, women physicians found EHR

metadata.title: The Gender Gap in EHR Workload: A Comparative Analysis of Primary Care Physician In Basket Usage.
metadata.authors: Branford GL; Bucala MD; Hepper A; Hadeed NM; Northway RM; Brenner MJ

documents.content: 95% CI: 1.08-2.42, p = 0.0204). Interestingly, women physicians found EHR systems easier to learn (OR = 2.03, 95% CI: 1.37-3.02, p < .0001) and were less likely to feel EHRs inhibited quality care (OR = 0.57, 95% CI: 0.43-0.74, p < .0001) compared to men physicians. Gender disparities exist in EHR

metadata.title: The Gender Gap in EHR Workload: A Comparative Analysis of Primary Care Physician In Basket Usage.
metadata.authors: Branford GL; Bucala MD; Hepper A; Hadeed NM; Northway RM; Brenner MJ

documents.content: p < .0001) compared to men physicians. Gender disparities exist in EHR usage and patient communication, and these disparities are associated with increased burnout risk among women physicians. Effective leadership engagement is essential for optimizing EHR workflows, promoting equitable work

metadata.title: The Gender Gap in EHR Workload: A Comparative Analysis of Primary Care Physician In Basket Usage.
metadata.authors: Branford GL; Bucala MD; Hepper A; Hadeed NM; Northway RM; Brenner MJ

documents.content: is essential for optimizing EHR workflows, promoting equitable work practices, and implementing flexible work provisions that ensure safe and sustainable care delivery.

Molecular docking revealed a strong binding affinity between Cr(D-Phe)₃ and

documents.content: The COVID-19 vaccines have been public for several years and have been shown to mitigate symptoms in recipients. documents.content: Primordial germ cells (PGCs) are undifferentiated embryonic germ cells with the unique potential to develop into gametes. It is widely recognized that PGC development involves the activation of germ cell-specific genes and the repression of certain pluripotency genes. However, little is known about

metadata.title: Transcriptome-Wide Sequencing Identifies Non-Coding RNAs and Their Competing Endogenous RNA Networks During the Stages of pPGCLCs-Induced Differentiation.

metadata.title: Transcriptome-Wide Sequencing Identifies Non-Coding RNAs and Their Competing Endogenous RNA Networks During the Stages of pPGCLCs-Induced Differentiation.

metadata.title: Transcriptome-Wide Sequencing Identifies Non-Coding RNAs and Their Competing Endogenous RNA Networks During the Stages of pPGCLCs-Induced Differentiation.

metadata.title: Transcriptome-Wide Sequencing Identifies Non-Coding RNAs and Their Competing Endogenous RNA Networks During the Stages of pPGCLCs-Induced Differentiation.

To validate our analysis, we transfected miRNA inhibitors into cells.

documents.content: The Orphan Medicinal Product Regulation was adopted in the EU in 2000 to encourage the implementation of medicines for rare diseases. Providing a current overview of its effects, this study was performed on medicines with active orphan designation authorised in the EU until January 17, 2024. Based

metadata.title: Overview of Orphan Medicines in European Union: An Analysis of Regulatory and Technical-Scientific Aspects.
metadata.authors: Santi Laurini G; Nikitina V; Broccoli M; Montanaro N; Motola D

documents.content: orphan designation authorised in the EU until January 17, 2024. Based on the Community Register of orphan medicinal products for human use, active orphan designations of medicines that have been granted marketing authorisation (MA) were included in the study. General information on medicines,

metadata.title: Overview of Orphan Medicines in European Union: An Analysis of Regulatory and Technical-Scientific Aspects.
metadata.authors: Santi Laurini G; Nikitina V; Broccoli M; Montanaro N; Motola D

documents.content: (MA) were included in the study. General information on medicines, orphan designations, and MAs was collected from web-based sources and analysed using descriptive statistics. Since 2000, 149 medicines with clinical indications with active orphan designation have been granted MA in the EU, making a

metadata.title: Overview of Orphan Medicines in European Union: An Analysis of Regulatory and Technical-Scientific Aspects.
metadata.authors: Santi Laurini G; Nikitina V; Broccoli M; Montanaro N; Motola D

documents.content: with active orphan designation have been granted MA in the EU, making a total of 184 authorised orphan indications. Most medicines (96;64.4%) received standard MA, while 33 (22.1%) received conditional MA and 20 (13.4%) MA under exceptional circumstances. Sixty-five (43.6%) medicines were

metadata.title: Overview of Orphan Medicines in European Union: An Analysis of Regulatory and Technical-Scientific Aspects.
metadata.authors: Santi Laurini G; Nikitina V; Broccoli M; Montanaro N; Motola D

documents.content: MA under exceptional circumstances. Sixty-five (43.6%) medicines were biological products, mainly monoclonal antibodies, recombinant human peptides or enzymes, or gene therapies. Active orphan designations with outcome for MA were primarily for indications for neoplasms or endocrine, nutritional or

metadata.title: Overview of Orphan Medicines in European Union: An Analysis of Regulatory and Technical-Scientific Aspects.
metadata.authors: Santi Laurini G; Nikitina V; Broccoli M; Montanaro N; Motola D

documents.content: were primarily for indications for neoplasms or endocrine, nutritional or metabolic diseases. Orphan indications were licensed after a mean of 67.2 months (range 6-249 months) from designation date. For 93 (50.5%) orphan designations, the prevalence estimate of the condition in the EU was

metadata.title: Overview of Orphan Medicines in European Union: An Analysis of Regulatory and Technical-Scientific Aspects.

documents.content: designations, the prevalence estimate of the condition in the EU was ≤ 1/10,000. documents.content: Autoimmune glial fibrillary acidic protein astrocytopathy (A-GFAP-A) is a rare autoimmune central nervous system disorder associated with anti-GFAP IgG, presenting with meningoencephalitis or myelitis. Differential diagnosis from infectious causes, such as tuberculous meningitis (TBM), is

metadata.title: Misdiagnosis of autoimmune glial fibrillary acidic protein astrocytopathy as infectious meningitis: a case report.

documents.content: diagnosis from infectious causes, such as tuberculous meningitis (TBM), is challenging due to overlapping clinical and radiological features. A 24-year-old Chinese female presented with acute headache, fever, and vomiting. The cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) analysis showed lymphocytic pleocytosis,

metadata.title: Misdiagnosis of autoimmune glial fibrillary acidic protein astrocytopathy as infectious meningitis: a case report.

documents.content: The cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) analysis showed lymphocytic pleocytosis, elevated protein and decreased glucose level. Brain magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) showed diffuse leptomeningeal enhancement. She was initially diagnosed with infectious meningitis and emperically treated with antibiotics and

metadata.title: Misdiagnosis of autoimmune glial fibrillary acidic protein astrocytopathy as infectious meningitis: a case report.
metadata.authors: Wu C; Han X; Yang F; Zhang G; Zhao C

Subsequent MRI revealed the involvement of the whole spinal cord. CSF analysis identified anti-GFAP IgG (titer 1:32).

metadata.title: Misdiagnosis of autoimmune glial fibrillary acidic protein astrocytopathy as infectious meningitis: a case report.

documents.content: Ophthalmic diseases significantly impact vision and quality of life. Early diagnosis using fundus images is critical for timely treatment. Traditional deep learning models often lack accuracy, interpretability, and efficiency for multi-label classification tasks in ophthalmology. We propose

metadata.title: Hybrid attention-based deep learning for multi-label ophthalmic disease detection on fundus images.
metadata.authors: Hanfi R; Mathur H; Shrivastava R
metadata.journal: Graefe's archive for clinical and experimental ophthalmology = Albrecht von Graefes Archiv fur klinische und experimentelle Ophthalmologie

documents.content: for multi-label classification tasks in ophthalmology. We propose HAM-DNet, a hybrid deep learning model combining EfficientNetV2 and Vision Transformers (ViT) for multi-label ophthalmic disease detection. The model includes SE (Squeeze-and-Excitation) blocks for attention-based feature refinement

metadata.title: Hybrid attention-based deep learning for multi-label ophthalmic disease detection on fundus images.
metadata.authors: Hanfi R; Mathur H; Shrivastava R
metadata.journal: Graefe's archive for clinical and experimental ophthalmology = Albrecht von Graefes Archiv fur klinische und experimentelle Ophthalmologie

documents.content: SE (Squeeze-and-Excitation) blocks for attention-based feature refinement and a U-Net-based lesion localization module for improved interpretability. The model was trained and tested on multiple fundus image datasets (ODIR-5 K, Messidor, G1020, and Joint Shantou International Eye Centre). HAM-DNet

metadata.title: Hybrid attention-based deep learning for multi-label ophthalmic disease detection on fundus images.
metadata.authors: Hanfi R; Mathur H; Shrivastava R
metadata.journal: Graefe's archive for clinical and experimental ophthalmology = Albrecht von Graefes Archiv fur klinische und experimentelle Ophthalmologie

It outperformed existing models including

In genetically proven cases, mean b:a ratio in XLRS patients (b:a = 1.04) was significantly higher than cCSNB (b:a = 0.60, p < 0.001) and iCSNB (b:a = 0.60, p < 0.001). An electropositive ERG was significantly more likely to be associated with RS1 than iCSNB (p < 0.001) or

documents.content: The neuromodulator dopamine is known to play a key role in reward-guided decision making, where choice options are often characterized by multiple attributes. Different decision strategies can be used to merge these choice attributes with personal preferences (e.g., risk preferences) and integrate

metadata.title: Bidirectional modulation of reward-guided decision making by dopamine.
metadata.authors: Dias Maile AA; Gruendler TOJ; Fischer AG; Kurtenbach H; Kaiser LF; Froböse MI; Jocham G

documents.content: with personal preferences (e.g., risk preferences) and integrate them into a single subjective value. While the influence of dopamine on risk preferences has been investigated, it is unknown whether dopamine is also involved in arbitrating between decision strategies. In the present study, we

metadata.title: Bidirectional modulation of reward-guided decision making by dopamine.
metadata.authors: Dias Maile AA; Gruendler TOJ; Fischer AG; Kurtenbach H; Kaiser LF; Froböse MI; Jocham G

documents.content: in arbitrating between decision strategies. In the present study, we investigate the effects of pharmacological dopamine manipulations on arbitrating between different decision strategies in a healthy sample. 31 healthy male participants performed a reward-guided decision-making task under the

metadata.title: Bidirectional modulation of reward-guided decision making by dopamine.

The effect

The effect of dopamine on reward-guided decisions and decision strategies was analyzed using hierarchical implementations of regressions and Bayesian models. Notably, we observed that the dopaminergic interventions shifted the

documents.content: Notably, we observed that the dopaminergic interventions shifted the (overall) weighting of option attributes without changing how option attributes are integrated into a subjective value (decision strategy). These effects were bidirectional: Amisulpride reduced whereas L-DOPA increased the degree

metadata.title: Bidirectional modulation of reward-guided decision making by dopamine.
metadata.authors: Dias Maile AA; Gruendler TOJ; Fischer AG; Kurtenbach H; Kaiser LF; Froböse MI; Jocham G

documents.content: bidirectional: Amisulpride reduced whereas L-DOPA increased the degree to which choices were influenced by both reward magnitude and reward probability. These effects occurred in the absence of changes in statistically optimal behavior. Together, our data provide evidence for a role of dopamine in
